events.name: Clojure over lunch
events.description: Lets meet for lunch informally and chat about clojure, Your worst case scenario here is a good lunch!
events.location: Annalakshmi Central Square, 20 Havelock Road, Singapore

events.name: IoT for Smart City: Rapid Development for IoT on Bluemix
events.description: GCTC is a global initiative designed to advance the deployment of Internet of Things(IoT) technologies within a smart city/smart community environment. Following the kick-off of GCTC in the US, IBM is hosting a Bluemix Workshop locally on 25 November 2015.This event will include hands-on IoT workshop to demostrate tools available to help citizen developers to develop smart nation solutions using IoT technology, including one of our most exciting offerings, IBM Bluemix Come and learn more about how Bluemix can be used to build your IoT applications! Agenda-Introduction to Internet of Things-Internet of Things Foundation-Rapid Application Development for IoT on Bluemix-Beyond QuickStart - device registration & authentication-Where next - extracting value from IoT data-Hands-on activity & demostration  Refreshment is starts at 6pm!
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: DevOps at serv.sg
events.description:
**** Speaker ***** Nicolas Mas, CTO serv.sg **** Talk subject***** My main technical matter will be to talk about how we are building our java monolith app by features (and the underlying tools). I'll explain why we have to do that and why we are choosing to experiment the concept of immutable infra. I will also talk about how we found that devOps are the direct link between the product team and our customers and why we want to automate the delivery pipe as much as we can. My view will be from a devOps perspective but also from a CTO perspective , at a higher level. Shout out to ThoughtWorks for providing the venue and food and drinks. See you guys there! 


Christian & Satyam

events.name: Hackware v1.3 (Science Center Planetarium Special)
events.description: Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers.  Our talks typically include side projects by speakers on electronics, embedded system, radio communications, internet of things, radio frequency and much more! Come and just drop by for all our open and free meetups, make friends with fellow enthusiasts or beginners and feel free to sign up for a talk slot on whatever you are working on. We collaborate with Science Bites!, a science communication initiative in Science Centre Singapore this November to bring you the wonders of astronomy and science in SCS's Digital Planetarium! Agenda & Talks for this meetup: 1. (20min) Introduction to Digital Planetarium - Yong Jian-yi 2. (20min) TinyMOS (World's first consumer astronomy camera) - Grey Chen Junyang 3. (20min) Gravitational Redshift - Lerh Feng Low 4. (20min) Quantum Astronomy - Tan Peng Kian 5. Announcements by anyone on:- Hiring positions- Available for hire- Other upcoming hardware-related events locally or anywhere else 6. Socialize and Network with other Hackware members and public members Talks : ~20minsLightning Talks : ~5minsAnnouncements: ~1min Sponsors: ♥ Venue provided by Science Centre Singapore ♥http://www.science.edu.sg/Pages/SCBHome.aspx♥ Science Bites! on Prezi ♥http://prezi.com/infoz1o8umm7/
events.location: Digital Planetarium, Science Center Singapore, 21 Jurong Town Hall Road
